sen.j: 上村 淳之（うえむら あつし、1933年4月12日 -）は、日本画家、日本芸術院会員。
sen.e: Atsushi UEMURA (April 12, 1933 -) is a Japanese-style painter, and a member of the Japan Art Academy.
Atsushi UEMURA (April 12, 1933-) is a Japanese-style painter, and a member of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: ハイフン前後のスペース削除しました。
sen.e: Atsushi UEMURA (April 12, 1933-) is a Japanese-style painter, and a member of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 本名・淳（あつし）。
sen.e: His real name is written as 淳 in Chinese characters.
sen.cmt: 漢字の説明にしました
sen.e: His real name is written as 淳 in a Chinese character.
His real name is written as 淳 in a Chinese character.

sen.j: 奈良市在住。
sen.e: He lives in Nara City.
He lives in Nara City.
He lives in Nara City.

sen.j: 上村松篁の子として京都に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Kyoto, as a child of Shoko UEMURA.
He was born in Kyoto, as a son of Shoko UEMURA.
He was born in Kyoto, as a son of Shoko UEMURA.

sen.j: 父同様、花鳥画を描く。
sen.e: He paints Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds) as his father did.
He paints Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds) as his father did.
He paints Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds) as his father did.

sen.j: 上村松園は祖母で、親子三代続いての芸術院会員。
sen.e: His grandmother was Shoen UEMURA, and the three generations of the UEMURAs have been members of the Japan Art Academy.
His grandmother was Shoen UEMURA, and the three generations of the Uemura family have been members of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: 小文字化、family追加しました。
sen.e: His grandmother was Shoen UEMURA, and the three generations of the Uemura family have been members of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 松園、松篁、淳之三代の作品を展示する松伯美術館の館長も務める。
sen.e: He is the curator of the Shohaku Art Museum which exhibits the works of Shoen, Shoko, and Atsushi UEMURA.
He is the curator of the Shohaku Art Museum which exhibits the works of Shoen, Shoko, and Atsushi UEMURA.
He is the curator of the Shohaku Art Museum which exhibits the works of Shoen, Shoko, and Atsushi UEMURA.

sen.j: 京都市に生まれる
sen.e: He was born in Kyoto.
He was born in Kyoto.
He was born in Kyoto.

sen.j: 新制作協会展初入選
sen.e: He was accepted at the Shinseisaku Association Exhibition for the first time.
He was accepted for the Shinseisaku Association Exhibition for the first time.
He was accepted for the Shinseisaku Association Exhibition for the first time.

sen.j: 京都市立美術大学（現：京都市立美術大学）専攻科を修了
sen.e: He completed the specialty course of Kyoto City University of Fine Arts (present-day, Kyoto City University of Arts).
sen.cmt: ウェブ上では（現: 京都市立芸術大学）ですので、そのように訳しています
sen.e: He completed the non-degree course for graduates of Kyoto City University of Fine Arts (present-day, Kyoto City University of Arts).
sen.cmt: 「専攻科」を用語統一に合わせました。
sen.e: He completed the non-degree course for graduates of Kyoto City University of Fine Arts (present-day, Kyoto City University of Arts).

sen.j: 創画会賞受賞
sen.e: He received the Sogakai Award.
He received the Sogakai Award.
He received the Sogakai Award.

sen.j: 創画会会員となる
sen.e: He became a member of Sogakai.
He became a member of Sogakai.
He became a member of Sogakai.

sen.j: 京都市立芸術大学教授となる
sen.e: He became a professor at Kyoto City University of Arts.
He became a professor at Kyoto City University of Arts.
He became a professor at Kyoto City University of Arts.

sen.j: 京都府文化功労賞受賞
sen.e: He received Kyoto bunka koro sho (the Award for Cultural Distinguished Service by Kyoto Prefecture).
He received Kyoto bunka koro sho (the award for cultural distinguished service by kyoto prefecture).
He received Kyoto bunka koro sho (the award for cultural distinguished service by kyoto prefecture).

sen.j: 松伯美術館館長
sen.e: He became the curator of the Shohaku Art Museum.
He became the curator of the Shohaku Art Museum.
He became the curator of the Shohaku Art Museum.

sen.j: 日本芸術院賞受賞
sen.e: He received the Award of the Japan Art Academy.
He received the Award of the Japan Art Academy.
He received the Award of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 京都市立芸術大学美術学部長となる
sen.e: He became the dean of the Faculty of Fine Arts, Kyoto City University of Arts.
He became the dean of the Faculty of Fine Arts, Kyoto City University of Arts.
He became the dean of the Faculty of Fine Arts, Kyoto City University of Arts.

sen.j: 京都市立芸術大学副学長となる（2004年まで）
sen.e: He became the vice-president at Kyoto City University of Arts (until 2004).
He became the vice-president of Kyoto City University of Arts (until 2004).
He became the vice-president of Kyoto City University of Arts (until 2004).

sen.j: 日本芸術院会員
sen.e: He became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He became a member of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 京都市立学校歴史博物館館長となる
sen.e: He became the curator of Kyoto City School History Museum.
He became the curator of Kyoto City School History Museum.
He became the curator of Kyoto City School History Museum.

sen.j: 全日本学士会アカデミア賞受賞。
sen.e: He received the All-Japan Academy Award.
He received the All-Japan Academy Award.
He received the All-Japan Academy Award.

sen.j: 創画会理事長。
sen.e: He became the head of Sogakai.
He became the head of Sogakai.
He became the head of Sogakai.
